title.narrative: Health System Enhancement to Address and Limit (HEAL) COVID-19

description.narrative: The overall objective of this project is to strengthen the preparedness and response capacity of the Philippines Health System in regard to prevention, diagnosis and treatment of COVID-19, and in the longer term to become more cost-effective and sustainable. The provision of key equipment and the incorporation of new infrastructure to the health network of the Department of Health will strengthen the capacity of the health system in the Philippines to effectively treat COVID-19 cases. The expected outputs of this project are: Procurement of medical supplies (including Personal Protective Equipment), laboratory equipment and consumables for existing and newly constructed facilities, or facilities that will be constructed (by the DOH), and laboratories and isolation wards in the geographical locations spread throughout the Philippines including island local government unit (LGU) hospitals and provincial hospitals. Procurement and installation of equipment and housing for waste treatment facilities in 20 feet prefabricated containers, in 8 sites. Project management and oversight: coordination, monitoring and evaluation, administration, financial management and client reporting including quality control/assurance. Capacity building Including training programmes designed to meet the technical competency gaps in service delivery, as well as improve the referral practice and disaster preparedness capacity of the health system. The required competency areas will be provided through either in-service hospital training or through customized training programs
